lexa.core.expression.map

Class MapDataSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • lexa.core.data.BaseDataSet
      • lexa.core.data.ArrayDataSet
        • lexa.core.expression.map.MapDataSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<lexa.core.data.DataSet>, java.lang.Iterable<lexa.core.data.DataItem>, lexa.core.data.DataFactoryItem, lexa.core.data.DataSet

    public class MapDataSet
extends lexa.core.data.ArrayDataSet
    A DataSet backed by an ExpressionMap.
    If a field does not exist in the map then it will be evaluate from the provided expression map. Each field is evaluated once and only once.
    Since:
    2017-07
    Author:
    williamnw

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public lexa.core.data.DataItem get(java.lang.String key)
        Get an item from the data set

        If the item already exists then it's current value is used otherwise if an expression exists, then that is used instead.

        Specified by:
        get in interface lexa.core.data.DataSet
        Overrides:
        get in class lexa.core.data.ArrayDataSet
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the required item.
        Returns:
        the item corresponding to the key.

      • evaluate

        public lexa.core.data.DataSet evaluate()
        Evaluate all the expressions in the map.

        Go through all the defined fields in the map and return their evaluated values.

        Returns:
        the result of all the evaluations
